ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is a survey of current works in clinical psychology and gives a sampling of interesting and novel research from individuals at Yale and other institutions, as well as featuring student work.
An excellent opportunity to learn about a wide variety of research programs within clinical psychology. I would recommend it.
I would recommend it, because it is an excellent way to be exposed to state-of-the-art research in clinical psychology.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course consisted of talks by leading experts in clinical psychology. Hearing about their work was extremely beneficial to my own research and definitely deepened my knowledge of my discipline.
This course is very helpful to stay aware of relevant research and make connections with researchers at other institutions whose work could inform my own.
This course allows me to think about the content of my research as well as my strategies as a career researcher.
It exposed me to current research in the field and the chance to network/interact with prominent researchers.
